revised_title: The Hard and Soft States in Ductile Metals: A Study of Gold, Copper, and Silver
tldr: This article investigates the hard and soft states in ductile metals, focusing on gold, copper, and silver. The author discovers that the hardness of these metals is due to the development of a structure where distorted crystalline units are cemented together by a portion of the metal that has momentarily flowed around them. The study also examines the effects of heat on the crystalline structure of these metals, revealing that the changes in structure occur at relatively low temperatures.
